title: DigiFab (Digibind) Dosing for Digoxin Poisoning
description: Doses DigiFab in patients with confirmed digoxin poisoning or overdose

parameters.name: weight_kg
parameters.description: Patient body weight in kilograms (required for serum level method)

parameters.name: serum_digoxin_level
parameters.description: Serum digoxin level in ng/mL (required for serum level method)

parameters.name: amount_ingested_mg
parameters.description: Total amount of digoxin ingested in mg (required for amount ingested method)

result.name: digifab_vials
result.description: Number of DigiFab vials to administer (always rounded up)

ranges.interpretation: Administer calculated number of vials. Consider slow infusion over 2 hours if rhythm disturbances are not life-threatening.
Administer calculated number of vials. Typical dose for chronic toxicity in adults. Monitor patient closely for response.
Administer calculated number of vials. This suggests significant toxicity. Consider rapid infusion if life-threatening dysrhythmias present.
Administer calculated number of vials urgently. This indicates severe toxicity. For acute poisoning with serum digoxin >10 ng/mL, empiric dosing of 10-20 vials may be appropriate.
Critical toxicity requiring immediate intervention. Verify calculation and consider empiric maximum dosing. Consult toxicology immediately.

references: Lapostolle F, Borron SW, Verdier C, et al. Digoxin-specific Fab fragments as single first-line therapy in digitalis poisoning. Crit Care Med. 2008;36(11):3014-8.

Antman EM, Wenger TL, Butler VP Jr, Haber E, Smith TW. Treatment of 150 cases of life-threatening digitalis intoxication with digoxin-specific Fab antibody fragments. Final report of a multicenter study. Circulation. 1990;81(6):1744-52.
Bismuth C, Gaultier M, Conso F, Efthymiou ML. Hyperkalemia in acute digitalis poisoning: prognostic significance and therapeutic implications. Clin Toxicol. 1973;6(2):153-62.
formula: For serum level method: Number of vials = (serum digoxin level [ng/mL] × patient weight [kg]) / 100. For amount ingested method: Number of vials = (amount ingested [mg] / 0.5 mg/vial) × 0.8 (80% bioavailability). Always round up to the next whole number.
notes: Therapeutic range for serum digoxin is 0.8-2.0 ng/mL
Obtain serum digoxin level ≥6 hours after last dose for accurate results
Digoxin levels post-DigiFab will be falsely elevated due to bound digoxin
Empiric dosing: Acute poisoning 10-20 vials, Chronic adult 3-6 vials, Chronic child 1-2 vials
Slow infusion over 2 hours improves efficacy when dysrhythmias are not life-threatening
Avoid calcium salts in digoxin toxicity as they may worsen dysrhythmias
Each vial contains approximately 40 mg of digoxin-specific antibody fragments
